chapterTitle: Return, Risk, and The Security Market Line

columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to assess the market model.

The **market model** is a separate linear regression in which alpha is fixed, and beta represents the market stock's variable return. By multiplying the return with the company's beta, this model incorporates the major company's capital asset pricing model risk. The assumption of constant alpha, on the other hand, contradicts the premise that investment returns shift over time.
First, go to finance.yahoo.com and download Colgate-Palmolive's returns for the preceding 36 months. This spreadsheet will provide all of the information needed to complete this activity.

Then, use the market model to estimate the company's beta. The market model is as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
{\text{E(R}_{i}}){\text{ - R}_{f}}&={{\text{a + B[}}{\text{E(R}_{M})}{{-}}{\text{R}_{f}}}{{]}}{\text{+ e}}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

Where:
 
$${\text{E(R}_{i}}) = {\text{Expected return on asset}} \\
{\text{R}_{f}} = {\text{Risk-free}} \\
{\text{[E(R}_{M})}{{-}}{\text{R}_{f}}] = {\text{Marekt risk premium}}\\
{\text{B}} = {\text{Beta}} \\

{\text{a}} = {\text{Alpha}} \\
{\text{e}} = {\text{Error}} \\
After you determine the company's beta by using the formula in the previous step, you can now plot the monthly returns of the company by using a line graph.
